body.p: A template may specify a set of resources (CSS, JS, fonts) that will be copied to the output folder at the end of the transformation. This resources allows you to customize the generated output.
The type of resources that you can specify are:

dlentry.dd: One or more CSS files that will be linked in all generated HTML pages.

dd.note: It is required to have at least a CSS file.

dlentry.dd: Allows you to set a favicon for the WebHelp generated pages. This information is optional.

dd.p: Specifies a path to an image displayed as a logo in the left side of the output header. Optionally, you can associate a target URL to the logo image. When you click the logo image, you will be redirected to this address.
dd.note: The logo information is not required to be specified.

dd.p: Additional to CSS, logo or favicon you can specify one or more set of resources that will be copied to the output folder at the end of the WebHelp transformation.

To define the resources that will be included in the fileset, you can use one or more include elements. To exclude resources, use exclude element. The semantic of fileset, include and exclude is similar with ANT Fileset.
dd.note: All paths specified in the include or exclude elements are relative to the template root folder.

body.note: The relative paths specified in a template descriptor are relative to the template root folder.
body.p: The resources specified in the template descriptor are copied to the output folder in the /oxygen-webhelp/template folder. The next screenshot illustrates the mapping between the template resources and the location where they will be copied to the output folder.
